meanings.definition: To discontinue a session of a legislative body without dissolving it.
meanings.sent1: The Prime Minister decided to prorogate the parliament until further notice.
meanings.sent2: The decision to prorogate the meeting was met with mixed reactions from the members.
meanings.sent3: The Speaker's attempt to prorogate the debate was met with uproar from the opposition.
meanings.sent4: The sudden decision to prorogate the session left many bills unfinished.
meanings.sent5: The power to prorogate a session lies with the head of the legislative body.

meanings.sent1: I will prorogate my dentist appointment to next week.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to prorogate the launch of their new product due to unforeseen circumstances.
meanings.sent3: She had to prorogate her vacation plans due to a family emergency.
meanings.sent4: The teacher had to prorogate the test to allow more time for preparation.
meanings.sent5: It is better to prorogate a decision than to rush into it.

meanings.sent1: The warm weather prorogated the blooming season of the flowers.
meanings.sent2: The professor decided to prorogate the deadline for the research paper by a week.
meanings.sent3: The chef prorogated the cooking time to ensure the dish was perfectly cooked.
meanings.sent4: The negotiations were prorogated into the late hours of the night.
meanings.sent5: The artist prorogated the exhibition to showcase more of their artwork.
